tool.name: albatradis-scatterplot
tool.description: Create scatter plot of controls vs conditions
tool.command:
#import re
## Creates symlinks for each input file based on the Galaxy 'element_identifier' ## Used so that a human-readable name appears in the output table (instead of 'dataset_xyz.dat') #set $control_input_files = '' #for $control_input_file in $control ## Add single quotes around each input file identifier #set $control_input_file = "'{}'".format($input_file.element_identifier) ln -s '${control_input_file}' ${c_input_file} && #set $control_input_files = $control_input_files + ' --control ' + $c_input_file #end for
#set $condition_input_files = '' #for $condition_input_file in $condition ## Add single quotes around each input file identifier #set $_input_file = "'{}'".format($input_file.element_identifier) ln -s '${condition_input_file}' ${d_input_file} && #set $condition_input_files = $condition_input_files + ' --condition ' + $d_input_file #end for
#if $normalise $normalise #end if
#if $debug $debug #end if
albatradis-scatterplot -v $control_input_files $condition_input_files > $log

param.name: control
param.label: Select control files
param.help: The insert site plots of the controls, where you must have 2 or more (Default: None)

param.name: condition
param.label: Select condition files
param.help: The insert site plots of the conditions, where you must have 2 or more (Default: None)

tool.help:
usage: albatradis-scatterplot [options] --control control1.plot --control control2.plot --condition condition1.plot --condition condition2.plot
Create scatter plot of controls vs conditions
This script produces scatterplots of your input data plotted against itself and the controls. It is useful as a QC metric to see if the data is biased. Basically you take sliding windows, count the number of reads in each window, then plot those values against the other condition and against the others. This is on a log scale and the outliers are the interesting points.
Documentation can be found at `<https://github.com/quadram-institute-bioscience/albatradis>`_.
